etymologies: Old English meal(u)we, from Latin malva; related to Greek malakhē; compare with mauve

definitions: a herbaceous plant with hairy stems, pink or purple flowers, and disk-shaped fruit. Several kinds are grown as ornamentals, and some are edible.

notes.text: Genus Malva, family Malvaceae (the mallow family): many species. This family also includes the hollyhocks, hibiscus, and abutilon. See also marshmallow, rose mallow

shortDefinitions: herbaceous plant with hairy stems, pink or purple flowers
